Subjective: Back pain radiating down right leg, thigh, and lower leg to foot; worsens over time; difficulty sleeping; tingling sensation in right leg; dull sensation on outside of right lower leg; pain when lifting right leg; reduced sensation in right leg. Unable to work due to pain; impacting sleep.
Objective: BP: not recorded; HR: not recorded; RR: not recorded; Temp: not recorded. Physical exam: right leg strength normal; reflexes normal; sensation decreased on right lower leg.
Assessment: Lumbosacral radicular syndrome, suspected herniated nucleus pulposus (HNP). No signs of cauda equina syndrome.
Plan: Pain relief: pregabalin (build up dose slowly due to side effects)
Physiotherapy to improve back flexibility and reduce nerve compression
Telephone follow-up in 1 week to discuss pain relief progress
Safety netting: contact doctor or GP out-of-hours service if symptoms worsen (e.g., loss of sensation in perineal area, inability to urinate or defecate, significant weakness in right leg)
